item.title: Pope Cuts Short Visit to Typhoon-Hit Philippines Region Because of Bad Weather
item.description: Francis on Saturday fulfilled a pledge to meet with victims of Typhoon Haiyan, but he left early because of another storm.
item.dc:creator: By FLOYD WHALEY

item.title: 2014 Breaks Heat Record, Challenging Global Warming Skeptics
item.description: Extreme land temperatures were accompanied by an unusually warm ocean surface virtually everywhere except around Antarctica, scientists reported.
item.dc:creator: By JUSTIN GILLIS
item.media:credit: Louise Murray/Robert Harding World Imagery, via Corbis
item.media:description: Runners in Siberia, which experienced record heat in 2014.

item.title: As Pope Francis Visits Philippines, Tensions Between Church and Government Surface
item.description: After meeting with the pope, President Benigno S. Aquino III said that church leaders in the Philippines had been overly critical of him.
item.dc:creator: By FLOYD WHALEY
item.media:description: A huge crowd gathered Friday in Manila to welcome Pope Francis, among them a boy holding a doll dressed as the pope. A Sunday Mass to be led by Francis is expected to draw eight million people. The pope’s visit ends Monday.

item.title: Turkey Threatens to Block Social Media Over Released Documents
item.description: The government wanted Twitter to prevent a left-wing newspaper from circulating accounts of a raid by the military police.
item.dc:creator: By SEBNEM ARSU

item.title: Nigeria: 2 Regions Report New Outbreaks of Bird Flu
item.description: The health and veterinary authorities on Friday reported outbreaks of avian flu hundreds of miles apart on opposite ends of Nigeria.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: China: 22 People Missing After Boat Capsizes in River
item.description: Rescuers cut through the bottom of an upended tugboat on Friday to free a Chinese interpreter and searched for 22 other people after the vessel capsized in the Yangtze River.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: A Former Commander of Liberian Rebels Is Arrested in Switzerland
item.description: Alieu Kosiah is accused of ordering massacres and rapes in northern Liberia during the country’s first civil war, from 1989 to 1996.
item.dc:creator: By CLAIR MacDOUGALL

item.title: Malawi: 176 Killed and Thousands Displaced by Floods
item.description: Flooding in Malawi has killed more than 176 people, displaced at least 200,000, left homes and schools submerged in water and washed away roads.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: U.S. and Britain Present a United Front
item.description: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron, vowing new cooperation after the terrorist attacks in Paris, agreed to bolster cybersecurity and step up training of Iraqi forces to counter the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

item.title: Patriot Act Idea Rises in France, and Is Ridiculed
item.description: After the shootings in Paris last week, France finds itself grappling with how to fight terrorism while protecting civil liberties — a question the United States has confronted since 9/11.
item.dc:creator: By MATT APUZZO and STEVEN ERLANGER

item.title: Robert E. White, Ex-Ambassador to Latin America, Dies at 88
item.description: He fought for justice on behalf of four churchwomen who were abducted, raped and murdered in El Salvador.
item.dc:creator: By SAM ROBERTS
item.media:description: Robert E. White, a career diplomat, served every president from Dwight D. Eisenhower to Ronald Reagan.

item.title: Suspect in Disappearance of 43 Mexican Students Is Held
item.description: Felipe Rodríguez Salgado, the leader of the criminal group that prosecutors believe killed the students, was being questioned.
item.category: Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico)
Pineda Villa, Maria de los Angeles
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETH MALKIN

item.title: French Theaters to Screen Film About Charlie Hebdo
item.description: A week after Charlie Hebdo lost 12 members of its staff in a terrorist attack, more than a hundred movie theaters across France will screen a documentary on the satirical newspaper in a show of support.
item.dc:creator: By MAÏA de la BAUME

item.title: Pentagon Will Send Troops to Train Some Syrian Rebels
item.description: The mission, to take place in Saudi Arabia, will include about 400 soldiers and hundreds of others to provide logistics, communications and other support.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By HELENE COOPER

item.title: U.S. and Britain Present a United Front
item.description: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron, vowing new cooperation after the terrorist attacks in Paris, agreed to bolster cybersecurity and step up training of Iraqi forces to counter the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

item.title: A Nurse Decides to Get Hands-On in the Ebola Zone
item.description: While most accounts of American health workers have focused on the ones returning, Lindsey Hallen, an emergency room nurse in Manhattan, is heading to West Africa to fight an epidemic that has killed more than 8,000 people.
item.dc:creator: By ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS
item.media:credit: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times
item.media:description: Lindsey Hallen has two years of experience working with critically ill patients in this country.

item.title: Myanmar Sweeps Up Copies of Film Mocking Kim Jong-un
item.description: DVD vendors said police officers were sometimes accompanied by North Korean officials as they visited shops to seize copies of the controversial film.
item.dc:creator: By WAI MOE and CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Caning of Saudi Blogger Is Delayed Amid Protests
item.description: Saudi Arabia delayed a second round of caning against a writer jailed for criticizing the religious establishment after a video of the first round appeared online and drew international condemnation.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: A rally Friday at the Saudi Embassy in Vienna against the caning of a writer who had criticized the Saudi religious establishment.

item.title: Court to Look Into Possible Israeli War Crimes in Palestinian Territories
item.description: The investigation begun by the International Criminal Court chief prosecutor came two weeks after the Palestinians joined the treaty that created the court.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE and ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: As Europe Moves Aggressively Against Terrorism, New Challenges Emerge
item.description: A spate of police raids and arrested suspects showed the complexity of the challenge facing intelligence agencies and security services in confronting the expanding threat from radical jihadis.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By ALISON SMALE and JAMES KANTER
item.media:description: Investigators checked the entrance of an apartment in the east of Belgium on Friday.
